content:
FigureLength Struct

In this Article

Describes the height or width of a Figure.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter(typeof(System.Windows.FigureLengthConverter))]
public struct FigureLength : IEquatable<System.Windows.FigureLength>

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.ValueType
  • FigureLength

Remarks

XAML Attribute Usage

<object property="length"/>  
- or -  
<object property="qualifiedDouble"/>

XAML Values

length
The width or height of the Figure in pixels, described as a Double value. Alternatively, this value can be qualified with a unit declaration string (px, in, cm, pt) see qualifiedDouble below.

qualifiedDouble
A double value as described above followed by one of the following unit declaration strings: px, in, cm, pt.

px (default) is device-independent units (1/96th inch per unit)

in is inches; 1in==96px

cm is centimeters; 1cm==(96/2.54) px

pt is points; 1pt==(96/72) px

Constructors summary

FigureLength(Double)

Initializes a new instance of the FigureLength class with the specified number of pixels in length.
FigureLength(Double,FigureUnitType)

Initializes a new instance of the FigureLength class with the specified stem.Windows.FigureLength.Value* and stem.Windows.FigureLength.FigureUnitType*.

Properties summary

FigureUnitType

Gets the unit type of the stem.Windows.FigureLength.Value*.
IsAbsolute

Gets a value that determines whether this FigureLength holds an absolute value (in pixels).
IsAuto

Gets a value that determines whether this FigureLength is automatic (not specified).
IsColumn

Gets a value that determines whether this FigureLength has a FigureUnitType property value of FigureUnitType.
IsContent

Gets a value that determines whether this FigureLength has a FigureUnitType property value of FigureUnitType.
IsPage

Gets a value that determines whether this FigureLength has a FigureUnitType property value of FigureUnitType.
Value

Gets the value of this FigureLength.

Methods summary

Equals(Object)

Determines whether the specified Object is a FigureLength and whether it is identical to this FigureLength.
Equals(FigureLength)

Compares two FigureLength structures for equality.
GetHashCode()

Returns the hash code for this FigureLength.
ToString()

Creates a String representation of this FigureLength.

Operators summary

op_Equality(FigureLength,FigureLength)

Compares two FigureLength structures for equality.
op_Inequality(FigureLength,FigureLength)

Compares two FigureLength structures for inequality.

Constructors

  • FigureLength(Double)

    Initializes a new instance of the FigureLength class with the specified number of pixels in length.

    public FigureLength (double pixels);

    Parameters

    • pixels
      Double

      The number of device-independent pixels (96 pixels-per-inch) that make up the length.

    Example

    In the following example, when the user clicks on the Figure, the Width of the Figure decreases. Below is the XAML for the sample. 

    <Page xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"
  xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
  x:Class="SDKSample.FigureLengthExample" >

  <FlowDocumentReader>
    <FlowDocument >
      <Paragraph>
        Raw text inside the paragraph
        <Figure Name="myFigure" Width="300">
          <Paragraph FontStyle="Italic" MouseDown="OnMouseDownDecreaseWidth" >
            Text inside of paragraph that is inside Figure...
          </Paragraph>
        </Figure>
      </Paragraph>
    </FlowDocument>
  </FlowDocumentReader>



</Page>

    Below is the code used to decrease the Width of the Figure. 

    using System;
using System.Windows;
using System.Windows.Controls;
using System.Windows.Input;

namespace SDKSample
{
    public partial class FigureLengthExample : Page
	{

        void OnMouseDownDecreaseWidth(object sender, MouseButtonEventArgs args)
        {
            FigureLength myFigureLength = myFigure.Width;
            double widthValue = myFigureLength.Value;
            if (widthValue > 0)
            {
                myFigure.Width = new FigureLength((widthValue - 10), FigureUnitType.Pixel);
            }
        }
    }
}
  • FigureLength(Double,FigureUnitType)

    Initializes a new instance of the FigureLength class with the specified stem.Windows.FigureLength.Value* and stem.Windows.FigureLength.FigureUnitType*.

    public FigureLength (double value, System.Windows.FigureUnitType type);

    Parameters

    • value
      Double

      The stem.Windows.FigureLength.Value* of the FigureLength class.

    • type
      FigureUnitType

      The stem.Windows.FigureLength.Value* of the stem.Windows.FigureLength.FigureUnitType* class.

    Example

    In the following example, when the user clicks on the Figure, the Width of the Figure decreases. Below is the XAML for the sample. 

    <Page xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"
  xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
  x:Class="SDKSample.FigureLengthExample" >

  <FlowDocumentReader>
    <FlowDocument >
      <Paragraph>
        Raw text inside the paragraph
        <Figure Name="myFigure" Width="300">
          <Paragraph FontStyle="Italic" MouseDown="OnMouseDownDecreaseWidth" >
            Text inside of paragraph that is inside Figure...
          </Paragraph>
        </Figure>
      </Paragraph>
    </FlowDocument>
  </FlowDocumentReader>



</Page>

    Below is the code used to decrease the Width of the Figure. 

    using System;
using System.Windows;
using System.Windows.Controls;
using System.Windows.Input;

namespace SDKSample
{
    public partial class FigureLengthExample : Page
	{

        void OnMouseDownDecreaseWidth(object sender, MouseButtonEventArgs args)
        {
            FigureLength myFigureLength = myFigure.Width;
            double widthValue = myFigureLength.Value;
            if (widthValue > 0)
            {
                myFigure.Width = new FigureLength((widthValue - 10), FigureUnitType.Pixel);
            }
        }
    }
}

Properties

  • FigureUnitType

    Gets the unit type of the stem.Windows.FigureLength.Value*.

    public System.Windows.FigureUnitType FigureUnitType { get; }

    Property Value

    • FigureUnitType

      The unit type of this stem.Windows.FigureLength.Value*. The default value is FigureUnitType.

    Remarks

    The value that goes along with this unit type can be found using the Value property.

    This property is read-only. To set the value of this property, use the FigureLength constructor.

  • IsAbsolute

    Gets a value that determines whether this FigureLength holds an absolute value (in pixels).

    public bool IsAbsolute { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if this FigureLength holds an absolute value (in pixels); otherwise, false. The default value is false.

  • IsAuto

    Gets a value that determines whether this FigureLength is automatic (not specified).

    public bool IsAuto { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if this FigureLength is automatic (not specified); otherwise, false. The default value is true.

  • IsColumn

    Gets a value that determines whether this FigureLength has a FigureUnitType property value of FigureUnitType.

    public bool IsColumn { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if this FigureLength has a FigureUnitType property value of FigureUnitType; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

  • IsContent

    Gets a value that determines whether this FigureLength has a FigureUnitType property value of FigureUnitType.

    public bool IsContent { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns true if this FigureLength has a FigureUnitType property value of FigureUnitType; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

  • IsPage

    Gets a value that determines whether this FigureLength has a FigureUnitType property value of FigureUnitType.

    public bool IsPage { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if this FigureLength has a FigureUnitType property value of FigureUnitType; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

  • Value

    Gets the value of this FigureLength.

    public double Value { get; }

    Property Value

    • Double

      The value of this FigureLength. The default value is 1.

    Remarks

    The unit type of this value can be found using the FigureUnitType property.

    This property is read-only. To set the value of this property, use the FigureLength or FigureLength constructor.

Methods

    Determines whether the specified Object is a FigureLength and whether it is identical to this FigureLength.

    Parameters

    Returns

      true if oCompare is a FigureLength and is identical to this FigureLength; otherwise, false.

  • Equals(FigureLength)

    Compares two FigureLength structures for equality.

    Parameters

    • figureLength
      FigureLength

      The FigureLength to compare to this instance.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if figureLength is identical to this FigureLength; otherwise, false.

  • GetHashCode()

    Returns the hash code for this FigureLength.

    public override int GetHashCode ();

    Returns

    • Int32

      The hash code for this FigureLength structure.

  • ToString()

    Creates a String representation of this FigureLength.

    • String

      A String representation of this FigureLength.

Operators

  • op_Equality(FigureLength,FigureLength)

    Compares two FigureLength structures for equality.

    public static bool op_Equality (System.Windows.FigureLength fl1, System.Windows.FigureLength fl2);

    Parameters

    • fl1
      FigureLength

      The first FigureLength structure to compare.

    • fl2
      FigureLength

      The second FigureLength structure to compare.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if fl1 and fl2 are equal; otherwise, false.

  • op_Inequality(FigureLength,FigureLength)

    Compares two FigureLength structures for inequality.

    public static bool op_Inequality (System.Windows.FigureLength fl1, System.Windows.FigureLength fl2);

    Parameters

    • fl1

      The first FigureLength structure to compare.

    • fl2

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if fl1 and fl2 are not equal; otherwise, false.
